summary: Sysbook separation testing complete. All backend APIs and frontend UI working correctly. Backend /api/sysbook/* endpoints properly filter to PCA products (25 total). Frontend shows SYSBOOK navigation group with Inventory, Stock Movements, Analytics pages. Original Unatienda section still works.
passed_tests: Backend: /api/sysbook/stock-orders returns only PCA catalog_type orders
Backend: Original /api/store/* endpoints still work (not broken)
Frontend: SYSBOOK navigation group visible in admin sidebar with Inventory, Stock Movements, Analytics items
Frontend: Sysbook Inventory page shows 25 products with correct stats (685 stock, 5 grades)
Frontend: Sysbook Inventory shows only All and Archive tabs (no Public/Textbooks tabs)
Frontend: Sysbook Analytics page shows KPI cards (Products=25, Total Stock=707, Value=$22,620.37)
Frontend: Sysbook Analytics shows grade breakdown chart, subject chart, and movement trends chart
Frontend: Sysbook Stock Movements page shows stock orders with Shipment/Return/Adjustment buttons
Frontend: Original Unatienda section still works (27 products including both PCA and public)
critical_code_review_comments: Backend Sysbook router (/api/sysbook/*) properly mounted with PCA_FILTER = {is_private_catalog: True}
Frontend SysbookInventoryTab passes sysbook=true prop to PrivateCatalogTab for API routing
AdminDashboard sidebar correctly groups Sysbook items under 'Sysbook' navigation group
All data-testid attributes present for testing (sysbook-analytics, sysbook-stock-movements, create-shipment-btn, etc.)
seed_data_creation: None - used existing 25 PCA products in store_products collection
context_for_next_testing_agent: Sysbook (School Textbooks renamed) separation is complete. Database has 25 PCA products (is_private_catalog=True), 2 public products. Total active products: 27. Backend has /api/sysbook/* routes that filter to PCA only. Frontend has modules/sysbook/ with SysbookInventoryTab, SysbookStockMovementsTab, SysbookAnalyticsTab. Admin sidebar shows SYSBOOK group. Unatienda section remains for managing all products (unified view).
